scenario_1.thought: As a union representative, my primary concern is the well-being of my members and, more broadly, fair labor practices. While I don't directly represent Person A in this scenario, the principles of collective bargaining prioritize a more equitable distribution of resources. The Left option gives me significantly more (600) but leaves Person A with nothing. This represents extreme inequality. The Right option gives me less (400), but provides Person A with a substantial amount as well (400). While I understand that the absolute amount I receive is important, the large disparity in the Left option violates the principles of fairness and shared prosperity that I advocate for as a union representative. Even though my individual payoff is lower, I believe the more equitable distribution of the Right option aligns more closely with my values and goals.
